newsitem.title: KAZAKHSTAN: Kazakh government sets up Air Kazakhstan airline.
newsitem.headline: Kazakh government sets up Air Kazakhstan airline.

text.p: The Kazakh government has set up a new national carrier, ZAO Air Kazakhstan, following the suspension of flights this week by state-owned Kazakhstan National Airways (KazAir), transport minister Yuri Lavrinenko told reporters.
Air Kazakhstan belongs to the State Property Committee. Privately owned Kazkommertsbank will lend the airline money, provide credit guarantees and manage the airline's finances, he said.
The head of the property committee, Sarybai Kalmyrzaev, said KazAir had $149 million of debts.
"This money will be repaid to creditors," he added, saying the company would be wound up.

"The new company must work efficiently and it will be clear from all debts," Kalmyrzaev said, adding that Air Kazakhstan would inherit only 20 percent of closed airline's fleet. He said the airline would buy new planes.
Kalmyrzaev also said that Air Kazakhstan would have the prospect of share emission to the end of this year.
Askar Alshimbaev, Kazcommertsbank deputy chief, said the bank would finance Air Kazakhstan activity, including the purchase of new aircraft.

Lavrinenko said the carrier would be registered with the International Civil Aviation Organisation (ICAO) in the next three months. "All scheduled domestic and international flights will be made during this period," he said.
